description:
Despite releasing into early access, Path of Exile 2 is filled to the brim with content. From the main story campaign to side bosses to an endless endgame, you're certainly getting your money's worth by participating in early access. Some players could find hundreds of hours of gameplay in Path of Exile 2 just through the game's initial content.

However, if you're trying to gauge exactly how much time you have to spend in Path of Exile 2 before "beating it," that's another story. Below, you can find how long it takes to beat Path of Exile 2, how long it takes to reach the endgame, and a full quest list so you can track your progress.

How long to beat Path of Exile 2

description:
Path of Exile 2 has a three-act campaign experience in early access plus loads of endgame content to dive into. You can take part in the story as a solo character, only relying on your abilities for help, or as a part of a six-player party. Five additional players are supported to join you on your journey, but you're free to make a party of any size up to that number.

While making a party for your friends and blasting your way through Path of Exile 2 together sounds great, the logistics of getting that set up can be complicated. Allow us to explain everything you need to know about adding friends and making a party in Path of Exile 2.

title: Publishers Reportedly Waiting For GTA 6 Release Date Before Setting Their Own 2025 Dates

description:
Warner Bros. Games has announced that Season 4 will be the last seasonal update for Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League. An offline mode will also be added as part of the final season.

Season 4 will start with Episode 7 on December 10 and conclude with Episode 8 on January 14, 2025. The offline mode will let players experience the game's campaign and seasonal story mission content without an internet connection. However, players will have to be online in order to make progress on battle passes, buy things from the in-game store, and access leaderboards.

Warner Bros. Games also clarified that the studio has no plans to shut down the online servers for the game, and that the in-game currency, LutherCoin, can still be purchased after Season 4. The final season sees Deathstroke j
title: Suicide Squad: Kill The Justice League Seasonal Updates Ending, With Offline Mode Coming Soon

description:
Magik, an infrequent member of the X-Men, is a bruiser in Marvel Rivals, moving a bit slower than other melee-focused heroes like Wolverine and Spider-Man, but hitting a bit harder. She uses her sword and Limbo portals to take out big chunks of enemy health bars, while sustaining herself with bonus health thanks to her passive ability. While there is no shortage of Duelists to choose from on the Marvel Rivals roster, Magik's capabilities make her a great pick for anyone who likes to run straight at their opponents.


Magik Overview
title: Marvel Rivals Magik Hero Guide

Players can progress through three campaign Acts, dozens of varied and challenging bosses, six distinct classes, and plenty of different gear iterations.

description:
The Monk is one of the six available classes in the early access build of Path of Exile 2. It's a mixed melee and ranged class that has access to a few different types of builds, all of which are hugely rewarding if used properly. While the Monk seems fairly weak at the start of Path of Exile 2, it only gets stronger as the game goes on, culminating in an extremely strong endgame character.

If you want some tips on how to build your Monk or advice on what skills to use, we have everything you need in the guide below.

Monk Overview in Path of Exile 2

When you first start Path of Exile 2 as a Monk, you'll have access to a constant quarterstaff melee attack, as well as some basic ranged, elemental skills. The Monk can make use of both lightning and frost damage as well as air skills that can damage and/or stun enemies. title: Path Of Exile 2: Best Monk Build Guide

description:
2024 is coming to a close.


2024 is all but over, and it was momentous, with major storylines, game releases, and trends cementing their place in another busy year for gaming. But what were the biggest news events for the year? No list could possibly be complete or perfect, but we're spending some time looking back at the year that was and putting together a rundown of the biggest news of 2024.

One of the biggest storylines of 2024 is a continuation of one from 2023: layoffs, studio closures, and other challenging news for the people who make games. Layoffs and closures rocked the video game industry in 2024, with some estimates putting job losses in 2024 alone to more than 11,000. title: The Biggest Gaming News Of 2024: Xbox's Evolution, Shutdowns, And A Dearth Of GTA 6 And Switch 2

description: There’s a lot to love about the PS5 DualSense controller, but there’s also one big oversight--it doesn’t use Hall Effect joysticks. That means it can--and often does--succumb to joystick drift over time, which is less than ideal for a $75 gamepad. Thankfully, Hyperkin has just released a PS5 Hall Effect Joystick Replacement Kit, allowing you to replace both sticks for just $16. They’re proving to be wildly popular (Amazon is temporarily out of stock), but you can still place orders while waiting for inventory to replenish.
title: PS5 DualSense Hall Effect Stick Replacements Now Available

description:
The partnership between Xbox and IHOP kicked off in November with a special-edition custom pancake Xbox and a menu inspired by Indiana Jones and the Great Circle. Now it's come to light that the partnership also includes the opportunity to get Indiana Jones and the Great Circle for "free" if you spend enough money at IHOP.

As spotted by Wario64, one of the perks of joining IHOP's loyalty program is the opportunity to earn PanCoins, which can be exchanged for a free copy of the game. It doesn't come cheap, though. Members earn one PanCoin for every $5 spent, and to unlock The Great Circle, you need 40 PanCoins ($200).

The Great Circle isn't the only game available, though, as 40 PanCoins also gets you a copy of Sea of Thieves, which is a completely different type of game. Me
title: Get The New Indiana Jones Xbox Game Free When You Eat $200's Worth Of Pancakes
New Pac-Man Plushies Are Launching In Celebration Of The Landmark Arcade Game's 45th Anniversary

description:
Legacy of Kain: Soul Reaver was ahead of its time when it launched in 1999 for the original PlayStation. From its storytelling and worldbuilding to the technical prowess behind its interconnected world and innovative Realm shifting, developer Crystal Dynamics created a near-masterpiece of environmental and narrative design, with ideas and concepts that still resonate to this day.

Now, 25 years later--and 21 years since the last game in the series--Legacy of Kain makes its overdue return with Legacy of Kain: Soul Reaver 1&2 Remastered, bundling together two of the greatest action-adventure games of all time. Developed in partnership with Crystal Dynamics and Aspyr--the latter of which recently launched the similarly packaged Tomb Raider I-III Remastered--this bundle reintroduces the world to vampire protagonist Raziel and his quest for revenge against the eponymous Kain. With improved visuals and a modern control scheme, it's a solid remaster that, abo
title: Legacy Of Kain: Soul Reaver 1&2 Remastered Review - My Wayward Son Returns

description:
Considering that it's taken over a decade for Grand Theft Auto 6 to reach players, expectations are sky high for Rockstar Games' next GTA installment. That anticipation and the hype behind it are being parodied on PlayStation Store with a page for Grand Taking Ages 6, a game that may or may not actually exist.

The listing for Grand Taking Ages 6 appears to have gone online around December 7, and it features what appears to be AI-generated art in the vein of GTA 6 along with a synopsis that suggests it will put players in charge of their own game studio simulation. According to the description, it allows fans to "run your dream game studio while juggling angry fans, corporate chaos, and endless delays. Fight your way through gaming conventions, dodge ruthless journalists, and master the art of creative excuses."
title: GTA 6 Parody Game Shows Up On PlayStation Store

description:
Surprise! CD Projekt Red still has more updates planned for Cyberpunk 2077, months after the Polish studio said it no longer had anyone working on the game. The studio has confirmed Cyberpunk 2077 Update 2.2, which will introduce "new features" to the role-playing game.

CD Projekt Red isn't ready to disclose what these features are but said it will host a video broadcast on December 10 where it will "dive deep" on what's coming to the game. The broadcast takes place at 8 AM PT / 11 AM ET / 5 PM CET on December 10, and it will be streamed live on Twitch and YouTube.

description:
Lego Fortnite is expanding in a big way this week. Not only are we getting a new Lego Pass with piles of new content for the existing Lego Fortnite survival/crafting game, but we're getting an entirely new Lego game, dubbed Brick Life.

Lego Fortnite Brick Life, which launches on December 12, is an open-world social sim in which you and 31 of your closest friends can hang out in Brick Bay, a lively Lego City that's full of activities, jobs, and empty lots you can build on, and Brick Bay will be expanding all the time. For example, December 18 will mark the opening of the Rooftop Club, a fancy social space that provides stunning views of the city from above. The launch of Brick Life happens to coincide with the addition of text chat to every Fortnite experience, which will be key for a social sim like this one.
title: Lego Fortnite Expands With New Social Sim Brick Life

description:
NetEase Games has announced that Marvel Rivals has hit 10 million players worldwide in the first 72 hours after launch.

Over on Twitter, the game's official account celebrated the milestone, saying, "We want to extend our heartfelt thanks to each and every one of you. Let’s ignite the battle together!" Marvel Rivals is a free-to-play team-based third-person shooter that has drawn comparisons to other hero shooters like Overwatch. It features iconic heroes from the Marvel franchise such as Iron Man, Doctor Strange, and Black Widow.

🎉 In just 72 hours, we’ve reached an incredible milestone of 10 million players worldwide! 🎉
We want to extend our heartfelt thanks to each and every one of you. 🫶
Let’s ignite the battle together! 💖
title: Marvel Rivals Hits A Huge Milestone During Launch Weekend

description:
The newest big Xbox exclusive game, Indiana Jones and the Great Circle, is officially available for everyone today, December 9--that is, if you own an Xbox or a PC or subscribe to Game Pass Ultimate. The adventure game doesn't come to PlayStation 5 until Spring 2025. In a new interview, Xbox president of game content and studios Matt Booty elaborated on Microsoft's decision-making process when it comes to bringing Xbox games to rival platforms.

"We are very much making the [exclusivity and windowing] decisions on a game-by-game basis," Booty told Variety, echoing comments he and other Xbox executives have made before.
title: How Microsoft Decides When Xbox Games Come To PlayStation
